Interface Location

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Coordinate

    public interface Location
    The Location interface to specify how x and y coordinates are represented. This can be used to represent the location of a ship or a shot. If the location is a shot, the isShipHorizontal() method can return an arbitrary value.
    Author:
    swapneel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getX()
      Gets the x coordinate.
      int getY()
      Gets the y coordinate.
      boolean isShipHorizontal()
      This method will indicate whether the ship is horizontal or vertical.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        int getX()
        Gets the x coordinate. It should return a number between 0 and 9. The top-left position will be 0, 0.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate

      • getY

        int getY()
        Gets the y coordinate. It should return a number between 0 and 9. The top-left position will be 0, 0.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate

      • isShipHorizontal

        boolean isShipHorizontal()
        This method will indicate whether the ship is horizontal or vertical. Can return an arbitrary value if the location is used to indicate a shot (and not a ship)
        Returns:
        true if ship is horizontal, false otherwise
